description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代至安土桃山时代的武将。因发动本能寺之变，逼使其主君织田信长自杀而闻名于世。其生年存在1516年与1528年等多种说法。
description.en: A Japanese samurai general of the Sengoku to Azuchi–Momoyama periods. Best known for orchestrating the Honnō-ji Incident, a coup d'état that led to the death of his lord Oda Nobunaga. His birth year is disputed, with sources suggesting either 1516 or 1528.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代至安土桃山时代的大名，于本能寺之变中遭部将明智光秀背叛而自尽。
description.en: A powerful daimyō of the Sengoku to Azuchi–Momoyama periods in Japan who was forced to commit suicide by his retainer Akechi Mitsuhide during the Honnō-ji Incident.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀于京都本能寺袭击其主君织田信长的事件，导致信长自杀，是日本史上著名的政变。
description.en: An incident in which Akechi Mitsuhide attacked his lord Oda Nobunaga at Honnō-ji in Kyoto, leading to Nobunaga's death. It is one of the most famous coups in Japanese history.

description.zh-cn: 羽柴秀吉为报织田信长之仇，与明智光秀之间的一场决战，以明智光秀的败亡告终。
description.en: A decisive battle between Hashiba Hideyoshi and Akechi Mitsuhide. Hideyoshi, seeking to avenge Oda Nobunaga, defeated Mitsuhide, leading to the latter's death.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代至安土桃山时代的武将，后来的丰臣秀吉。在山崎之战中击败明智光秀，为织田信长复仇。
description.en: A samurai and daimyō of the late Sengoku period, later known as Toyotomi Hideyoshi. He defeated Akechi Mitsuhide in the Battle of Yamazaki, avenging Oda Nobunaga.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀之父。
description.en: Father of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀之母。
description.en: Mother of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀的叔父，在光秀父亲早逝后照顾他。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide's uncle who took care of him after his father's early death.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀的正室。
description.en: The official wife of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀的嫡长子。
description.en: The eldest son and heir of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀的三女，细川忠兴的正室。
description.en: The third daughter of Akechi Mitsuhide and the wife of Hosokawa Tadaoki.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代的武将，细川玉子的丈夫。
description.en: A Japanese samurai warrior of the Sengoku period, husband of Hosokawa Tama.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代美浓国的大名，明智光秀早年侍奉的主君。
description.en: A daimyō of Mino Province during the Sengoku period, and an early lord of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 斋藤道三之子，与父亲内乱，明智光秀支持道三与其为敌。
description.en: Son of Saitō Dōsan. He had an internal conflict with his father, during which Akechi Mitsuhide supported Dōsan against him.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代越前国的大名，明智光秀曾在他麾下效力。
description.en: A daimyō of Echizen Province during the Sengoku period, whom Akechi Mitsuhide served for a time.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代的武将，明智光秀曾侍奉他。在本能寺之变后，他拒绝了光秀的拉拢。
description.en: A Japanese samurai daimyō of the Sengoku period whom Akechi Mitsuhide once served. He refused to ally with Mitsuhide after the Honnō-ji Incident.

description.zh-cn: 室町幕府的末代将军，明智光秀曾侍奉他。有说法称光秀发动本能寺之变是为了复兴幕府。
description.en: The 15th and final shōgun of the Ashikaga shogunate, whom Akechi Mitsuhide served. It is theorized that Mitsuhide launched the Honnō-ji Incident to restore the shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 丹波国的大名，被明智光秀击败。
description.en: A daimyō of Tanba Province, defeated by Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 大和国的战国大名，在本能寺之变后拒绝加入明智光秀一方。
description.en: A daimyō of Yamato Province. After the Honnō-ji Incident, he refused to join Akechi Mitsuhide's side.

description.zh-cn: 江户时代初期的天台宗僧侣。传说其真实身份为明智光秀。
description.en: A Tendai Buddhist monk of the early Edo period. Legend suggests that his true identity was Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 日本古代的令制国之一，位于今岐阜县南部，是明智光秀的出生地。
description.en: One of the old provinces of Japan, located in the southern part of modern-day Gifu Prefecture. It is the birthplace of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 位于今京都府京都市伏见区，是明智光秀在山崎之战败退后遇害的地点。
description.en: A location in present-day Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, where Akechi Mitsuhide was killed after his defeat at the Battle of Yamazaki.

description.zh-cn: 明智光纲是明智光秀的父亲。
description.en: Akechi Mitsutsuna was the father of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: お牧の方は明智光秀的母亲。
description.en: Oki no Kata was the mother of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光安是明智光秀的叔父及养父，在光秀父亲早逝后照顾他。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuyasu was Akechi Mitsuhide's uncle and adoptive father, who took care of him after his father's early death.

description.zh-cn: 妻木熙子是明智光秀的正室。
description.en: Tsumaki Hiroko was the official wife of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光庆是明智光秀的嫡子。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuyoshi was the eldest son of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 细川玉子是明智光秀的三女。
description.en: Hosokawa Tama was the third daughter of Akechi Mitsuhide.

description.zh-cn: 细川玉子是细川忠兴的正室。
description.en: Hosokawa Tama was the wife of Hosokawa Tadaoki.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀最初侍奉美浓大名斋藤道三。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide initially served Saitō Dōsan, the daimyō of Mino.

description.zh-cn: 在斋藤道三死后，明智光秀曾前往越前仕于朝仓义景。
description.en: After Saitō Dōsan's death, Akechi Mitsuhide went to Echizen to serve Asakura Yoshikage.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀在投靠织田信长前曾侍奉细川藤孝。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide served Hosokawa Fujitaka before pledging allegiance to Oda Nobunaga.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀曾侍奉室町幕府末代将军足利义昭，并随他一同投靠织田信长。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide served the last Ashikaga shōgun, Ashikaga Yoshiaki, and joined Oda Nobunaga's forces along with him.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀后随足利义昭一同投靠织田信长，并成为其重要家臣，直到在本能寺之变中反叛。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide, along with Ashikaga Yoshiaki, joined Oda Nobunaga and became one of his key retainers until his rebellion in the Honnō-ji Incident.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀率军发动本能寺之变，袭击并逼使织田信长自杀。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide led his army to launch the Honnō-ji Incident, attacking and forcing Oda Nobunaga to commit suicide.

description.zh-cn: 织田信长在本能寺之变中被部将明智光秀背叛，被迫自尽身亡。
description.en: Oda Nobunaga was betrayed by his general Akechi Mitsuhide in the Honnō-ji Incident and was forced to commit suicide.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀在山崎之战中被羽柴秀吉击败，并在败走途中被杀。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide was defeated by Hashiba Hideyoshi in the Battle of Yamazaki and was killed while fleeing.

description.zh-cn: 羽柴秀吉为给织田信长报仇，率军与明智光秀在山崎进行决战并取得胜利。
description.en: To avenge Oda Nobunaga, Hashiba Hideyoshi led his army to a decisive battle against Akechi Mitsuhide at Yamazaki and was victorious.

description.zh-cn: 在本能寺之变后，羽柴秀吉迅速回师讨伐明智光秀，并在山崎之战中将其击败。
description.en: After the Honnō-ji Incident, Hashiba Hideyoshi quickly returned with his army to attack Akechi Mitsuhide, defeating him at the Battle of Yamazaki.

description.zh-cn: 在斋藤道三与斋藤义龙父子内乱期间，明智光秀支持道三，与义龙为敌。
description.en: During the internal conflict between Saitō Dōsan and his son Yoshitatsu, Akechi Mitsuhide supported Dōsan, making him an enemy of Yoshitatsu.

description.zh-cn: 经过长期围攻，明智光秀最终攻陷八上城，成功击败波多野秀治，平定丹波国。
description.en: After a long siege, Akechi Mitsuhide finally captured Yagami Castle, successfully defeating Hatano Hideharu and pacifying Tanba Province.

description.zh-cn: 在本能寺之变后，明智光秀希望拉拢细川藤孝，但遭到拒绝，这阻碍了他巩固权力的计划。
description.en: After the Honnō-ji Incident, Akechi Mitsuhide hoped to win over Hosokawa Fujitaka, but was refused, which hindered his plans to consolidate power.

description.zh-cn: 在本能寺之变后，明智光秀希望拉拢筒井顺庆，但遭到拒绝，这阻碍了他巩固权力的计划。
description.en: After the Honnō-ji Incident, Akechi Mitsuhide hoped to win over Tsutsui Junkei, but was refused, which hindered his plans to consolidate power.

description.zh-cn: 传说在山崎之战中幸存的明智光秀后来化名为南光坊天海，并辅佐德川家康。
description.en: According to legend, Akechi Mitsuhide survived the Battle of Yamazaki and later assumed the identity of Nankōbō Tenkai, serving as an advisor to Tokugawa Ieyasu.
